name: Entropy Rising
description: Entropy Rising is a first-person physics-based puzzle game set in a weird world filled with mysterious flying orbs and oversized measurement devices. Control the forces of gravity, electricity, fire, water and acid. If anything goes wrong simply travel backwards through time.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or newer Processor: 1.8 GHz Dualcore Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD4000 or better DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1500 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or newer Processor: 2.2 GHz Dualcore Memory: 3 GB RAM Graphics: NVidia GeForce GTX 460, AMD Radeon HD 4850 or better DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: A review key was provided by the developers free of charge, but this has not, and will not, affect this review in any way.   Entropy Rising is a first person puzzle game. Playing through it you can tell it is heavily influenced by Portal and Braid, and possibly other puzzle games. I really enjoyed the puzzle aspect of this game, however I give it a cautious recommendation as it suffers from some presentation and pacing issues.   Thoughts, game play wise:

I participated in the beta and know some of the developers.  I personally really love puzzle games. This game is no exception. It has some really interesting ways of experimenting with gravity to create puzzles. Most of the time I really enjoyed the game. The only thing, I do not like so much, is the controls. Moving the balls around sometimes feels a bit random and slugish, which means that I had to try a while for solving a puzzle, even though I knew how to solve it in theory, just because the balls would fly off. Fortunately in most cases this can be fixed quickly by going back in time.  Overall a nice puzzle game :)

Pro: A very enjoyable puzzle game that uses a unique concept for controlling bubbles of gravity. It's also pretty cool that you can rewind time whenever you want. Con: There's no dialog or story, and it crashed once.
Managed to provide graphics worse than HL2 using the same settings and hardware.  ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Performance, ♥♥♥♥♥♥ graphics , lagger than 3A new games
